userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?

condition.description:
Hives are red and sometimes itchy bumps on your skin. An allergic reaction to a drug or food usually causes them. Allergic reactions cause your body to release chemicals that can make your skin swell up in hives. People who have other allergies are more likely to get hives than other people. Other causes include infections and stress.

Hives are very common. They usually go away on their own, but if you have a serious case, you might need medicine or a shot. In rare cases, hives can cause a dangerous swelling in your airways, making it hard to breathe - which is a medical emergency.
condition.name: Hives
symptoms: Red, itchy bumps on your skin

carousel_items: Take it once a day when needed.
Works the best if used regularly during allergy season.
Can give you a headache or diarrhea, but it rarely causes drowsiness or dizziness.

basics.benefits_moa: Desloratadine is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions.
basics.bottom_line: Desloratadine is a good option for once-daily allergy relief. It doesn't make you feel sleepy, but you need a prescription.
downsides: May not work as fast as the other antihistamines that make you sleepy (like Benadryl).
Not a good medication for pregnant women to take.

downsides_processed.orig: May not work as fast as the other antihistamines that make you sleepy (like Benadryl).
Not a good medication for pregnant women to take.

upsides: Relieves allergy symptoms like sneezing, runny nose, congestion, hives, or itchy skin.
Preferred for older people since it causes little to no drowsiness compared to other antihistamines like Diphenhydramine (Benadryl).
Works faster than other non-drowsy antihistamines like Loratadine (Claritin).
Side effects are rare and usually mild.
Available as a liquid or fast-dissolving tablet for people who don't like swallowing pills.

carousel_items: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

basics.benefits_moa: Famotidine is a type of antacid called an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Famotidine works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

upsides: Most people can take Famotidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Famotidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

Few drug interactions.

drugs.name: Pepcid

carousel_items_processed.orig: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

description_processed.orig: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. carousel_items: Use it only for eye allergy symptoms and not for eye infections.
If you wear contact lenses, take lenses out before using the eye drops. Wait at least 10 minutes after using Zaditor before putting the lenses back in.
If you have other eye drops, wait at least 5 minutes between different drops.
Can cause temporary burning or stinging.
Let your doctor know if your eye symptoms gets worse or don't improve after 3 days.
Check with the pharmacist to learn the best techniques for using eye drops.

basics.benefits_moa: Zaditor is a topical antihistamine and mast cell stabilizer. It blocks your body's reaction to allergens that irritate the eye.
basics.bottom_line: Zaditor is strong medicine for itchy eyes and doesn't expose the rest of your body to the medicine.
downsides: Doesn't treat for other types of allergy symptoms.
You need to have good hand-eye coordination to get the eye drops into your eyes.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't treat for other types of allergy symptoms.
You need to have good hand-eye coordination to get the eye drops into your eyes.

upsides: Works fast to relieve itchy eyes caused by allergies.
Most people don't have many side effects since it works in your eyes and doesn't affect the rest of your body.
It's available over the counter in the drugstore.

upsides_processed.orig: Works fast to relieve itchy eyes caused by allergies.
Most people don't have many side effects since it works in your eyes and doesn't affect the rest of your body.
It's available over the counter in the drugstore.

userStories.tip: When I forget to use it during allergy season my contacts get cloudy by the end of the day.

drugs.name: Zaditor

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use it only for eye allergy symptoms and not for eye infections.
If you wear contact lenses, take lenses out before using the eye drops. Wait at least 10 minutes after using Zaditor before putting the lenses back in.
If you have other eye drops, wait at least 5 minutes between different drops.
Can cause temporary burning or stinging.
Let your doctor know if your eye symptoms gets worse or don't improve after 3 days.

carousel_items: Starts working in a few hours. Only take it once a day.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid some of the side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead since it might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop instead can also work better to treat itchy or watery eyes.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyrtec is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. Antihistamines can also make you sleepy, but Zyrtec is a low-drowsiness version.
basics.bottom_line: Zyrtec is a once-daily allergy relief medication that won't make you feel too sleepy.
downsides: Although it works fast, its effectiveness wears off for some people over time.
Zyrtec can be slightly more sedating than Allegra or Claritin.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines, like Benadryl, are more effective for them than Zyrtec.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

downsides_processed.orig: Although it works fast, its effectiveness wears off for some people over time.
Zyrtec can be slightly more sedating than Allegra or Claritin.
Some people find that other more sedating antihistamines, like Benadryl, are more effective for them than Zyrtec.
If you have daily allergy symptoms, a prescription nasal steroid spray might be better for you long-term.

upsides: Zyrtec works as well as other antihistamines to treat sneezing and runny nose, but causes less sedation.
Works well to also treat hives and itchy skin.
Zyrtec is available over the counter without a prescription.
It comes as a tablet, liquid, and quick-dissolving tablet.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It's okay to take with most other medications because it has few drug interactions.
Most people don't get any side effects from Zyrtec.

upsides_processed.orig: Zyrtec works as well as other antihistamines to treat sneezing and runny nose, but causes less sedation.
Works well to also treat hives and itchy skin.
Zyrtec is available over the counter without a prescription.

It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It's okay to take with most other medications because it has few drug interactions.
Most people don't get any side effects from Zyrtec.

userStories.tip: If you have been suffering with allergies for day , you may need to take Zyrtec for a few days, even though many say it works within the first day.  It does if your just getting symptoms.  It will work though.
Take it at night. I found that it makes me slightly drowsy for 6-8 hours, so by taking it at night, I wake up without any drowsiness. The drowsiness is minimal for me, but noticeable
I often find that its suppression of allergy symptoms only lasts 12 hours,  rather than the 24 they claim.

Found out online that Zyrtec was going to be approved for chronic hives. Glory saints hallelujah I was so happy to discover it. Nothing else worked. Benedryl and other fast acting antihistimines were not making a dent, and slathering myself
Take it at night to help with drowsiness.
I appreciate that Zyrtec works without making me tired. I wish I had found the generic version at Costco more quickly!

I have multiple allergies & Zyrtec keeps them under control year-round (along with Singulaire for food allergies & Flonase for pollen.) I like it because it doesn't make me woozy the way Claritin does. Best taken right before bed.
A godsend. I'm not sure it's working as well after 10+ years.

drugs.name: Zyrtec

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in a few hours. Only take it once a day.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid some of the side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead since it might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop instead can also work better to treat itchy or watery eyes.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Zyrtec.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Zyrtec and stop using it if you have side effects.

description_processed.orig: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Zyrtec.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Zyrtec and stop using it if you have side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Zyrtec can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Zyrtec can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Overdosage
risks_warnings.description: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.

description_processed.orig: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.
